title: TV/CRT frame overlay for the Play screen emulator display

requirements.summary: Wrap the Play screen emulator canvas with a responsive TV/CRT frame overlay while preserving existing overlays and canvas sizing/behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: On the Play screen, the emulator display visually appears inside a TV/CRT frame (overlay) around the existing canvas.
The ROM upload overlay ("No ROM loaded" + file picker) and error overlay still appear above the canvas content and remain readable/clickable.
The TV/CRT frame scales responsively with the existing aspect-video container and does not distort the canvas rendering.
The overlay does not intercept pointer events intended for the ROM upload controls (i.e., frame overlay uses pointer-events: none where appropriate).

file_operations.description: Update the emulator display container to include a CRT/TV frame image overlay layered above the canvas but below the ROM upload/error overlays. Ensure the overlay is positioned with absolute layout inside the existing aspect-video wrapper, scales with it, and uses pointer-events: none so it does not block ROM upload interactions; keep existing canvas sizing (w-full/h-full, pixelated) and current overlay behaviors intact.

requirements.summary: Add the generated CRT/TV frame PNG as a static asset and render it from the Play screen emulator display container.
acceptanceCriteria: A new TV/CRT frame PNG exists at frontend/public/assets/generated/crt-tv-frame.dim_1600x900.png.
PlayScreen uses the static generated asset path (/assets/generated/crt-tv-frame.dim_1600x900.png) to render the frame overlay.
No backend changes are required for the TV/CRT frame display.

file_operations.description: Add the generated TV/CRT frame overlay image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/crt-tv-frame.dim_1600x900.png for use as a static overlay on the Play screen.

Render the static CRT frame overlay using the exact path /assets/generated/crt-tv-frame.dim_1600x900.png within the emulator display container, ensuring it visually frames the canvas without affecting emulator rendering or interaction layers.
